question: In the Roman numeral system, letters represent numbers. How is the year 2024 represented in Roman numerals?
China and Russia border the most nations (14). Which of these countries do not border China?
How many adverbs are in the following quote by Maya Angelou, “Hoping for the best, prepared for the worst, and unsurprised by anything in between.“
Pi is an irrational number with an infinite sequence of digits. What is the third digit of pi squared?
Before the Declaration of Independence, the United States comprised thirteen colonies governed by the Kingdom of Great Britain. In which century did the United States gain independence?
The bubonic plague can cause severe and deadly symptoms. However, which of these is not a typical symptom of the bubonic plague?
Every U.S. state has a motto representing its values or ideals. Which of these is not a motto of any U.S. state?
incorrect: Ua Mau ke Ea o ka ‘Āina i ka Pono
Our liberties we prize, and our rights we will maintain.
United we stand, divided we fall
Ense Petit Placidam Sub Libertate Quietem
With God, all things are possible

question: Russia is divided between Europe and Asia, and many of its major cities lie in the European part. Which of these cities is not located in European Russia?
The president of the United States is both the head of state and head of government. If the date was January 1, 2021, how many U.S. presidents would there have been in history?
A figure of speech is a creative way of using language to convey meaning. What figure of speech is present in the sentence “Winning that championship quiz bowl match wasn’t an easy task“?
Aristotle and Plato are key figures in ancient philosophy, known for their foundational works on ethics and politics. Plato is to the Republic as Aristotle is to?
A derivative is the instantaneous rate of change of a function with respect to its input. What would the derivative of sec²x be?
Steven Spielberg is widely regarded as one of the greatest film directors of all time and is the most commercially successful director in film history. Which of these films was not directed by him?
incorrect: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
Close Encounters of the Third Kind

question: The shortest war in history was between the United Kingdom and the Sultanate of Zanzibar on August 27, 1896, lasting approximately 40 minutes. Zanzibar eventually merged with Tanzania to form which modern nation?
The SAT is a standardized test developed by the College Board and is widely used for college admissions in the United States. What was the SAT originally called?
Now primarily focused on his philanthropic efforts, which businessman became the first centibillionaire (net worth of 100 billion)?
The Ivy League contains eight globally-renowned universities associated with academic excellence. Which Ivy League school was originally established as the Collegiate School?

The Mississippi River is the second longest river in North America only behind one of its tributaries, the Missouri River. Which U.S. state is the largest by total area (land and water) entirely east of the Mississippi?
This U.S. president earned the nickname “Old Tippecanoe“ after leading a military force against Tecumseh's confederacy at the Battle of Tippecanoe.
This tropical cyclone at its peak intensity was the largest tropical cyclone on record with a wind diameter of 1,380 mi (2,220 km) and had the lowest sea-level pressure ever at 870 mbar (25.69 inHg).
This violinist is often considered one of the greatest of all time was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom and has won 16 Grammy Awards.

Marie Curie was a physicist and chemist known for her groundbreaking research on radioactivity and was the first person to have won two Nobel Prizes. What is the name of her husband with whom she shared the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics?
By 1860, many world borders had become generally recognizable to modern-day borders. Which of these countries did not exist in the year 1860?
incorrect: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland
